<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/us-companies-trouble-finding-qualified-workers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Anyone Know a Good Line Cook?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/us-companies-trouble-finding-qualified-workers" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Hiring sign" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjQ2L2hpcmluZ19zaWduLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Paul Weaver/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This may sound bizarre following an economic lockdown that caused more than 20 million jobs to evaporate, but many US companies can't find enough employees to fill their open positions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">First, the headline stat: </strong>US job openings <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-job-openings-jump-to-two-year-high-in-boost-to-labor-market-idUSKBN2BT1TY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged</a> to a two-year high in February, the Labor Department said yesterday. That number blew past economists' expectations and, when paired with last Friday's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/us-hiring-surges-march-bigger-rebound-sight?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">A+ jobs report</a>, shows that employers are ready to hand out offer letters like Lyft discount codes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If only there were workers to accept them.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Which sectors are having recruitment trouble?  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Restaurants: </strong>On April 21, Taco Bell is holding interviews in thousands of parking lots, and candidates don't even have to get out of their cars to apply. The goal is to hire at least <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-fast-food-labor/fast-food-struggles-to-hire-as-demand-soars-u-s-economy-roars-idUSKBN2BT1GB?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5,000 people in a single day</a> to keep up with demand for Quesalupas. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other restaurant execs are facing similar issues. The staffing situation is a "total nightmare," the CEO of Johnny Rockets owner FAT Brands told Reuters.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Airlines:</strong> Last week, United told staff it plans to hire hundreds of pilots to meet the growing itch to travel. Delta was forced to cancel almost 100 flights over Easter weekend due to a pilot shortage. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Manufacturing: </strong>Factory activity in the US hit its highest level in 37 years in March, but it <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy-jobs-manufacturing/u-s-factories-desperate-for-workers-even-as-ranks-of-jobless-remains-high-idUKKBN2BP0ZI?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">would've been higher</a> had there been enough qualified workers to helm production lines. If anyone reading this is a trained welder, there’s a good-paying job for you. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's going on? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The speed and force of the economic recovery have surprised some employers that dramatically lowered their payrolls last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Business owners also point to the extra unemployment benefits from the $1.9 trillion stimulus package for keeping would-be workers at home, although research from earlier in the pandemic concluded that the extra weekly benefits did <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/03/is-600-unemployment-boost-a-disincentive-to-work-no-economists-say.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not disincentivize work</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>When the job market tightens → salaries get a bump and HR departments start throwing around referral bonuses. Applebee’s is paying $3,000 for manager referrals after the first six months.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/credit-suisse-announces-costcutting-measures-wake-scandal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Credit Suisse's Walk of Atonement
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If showrunners for HBO's <em>Industry</em> are looking for Season 2 inspiration...may we present Credit Suisse?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After March's collapse of Archegos Capital Management cost Credit Suisse almost $4.7 billion, the bank <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/06/investing/credit-suisse-archegos-losses/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday it's pulling executive board bonuses, suspending buybacks, cutting its dividend, and letting its top investment banker and chief risk officer go.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A pattern or apophenia?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Switzerland's second-largest bank surely wants to sweep this under the "unprecedented" banner of the last year. But Archegos is its fourth high-profile slip-up in the last 18 months.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Also in March, Credit Suisse froze $10 billion in funds tied to collapsed financial firm Greensill Capital. It could face ~$1.5 billion in losses.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In April 2020, an accounting scandal imploded Luckin Coffee, whose IPO was underwritten by...Credit Suisse. The bank was on the hook for $100 million worth of defaulted loans.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And before that, then-CEO Tidjane Thiam stepped down after the bank admitted to spying on former employees.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>While investors rewarded Credit Suisse for taking action yesterday, its shares are down over 25% since the start of March.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPAC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/topps-taking-baseball-cards-soontobe-nfts-public?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Topps Finds Its SPAC Zone
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/topps-taking-baseball-cards-soontobe-nfts-public" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Topps Goes Public" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjUwL3RvcHBzX2dvZXNfcHVibGljLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Baseball card collectors: You can finally tell your parents those boxes in their basement are worth something.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Collectibles-and-more company Topps said it’s <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/michael-eisner-taking-trading-card-company-topps-public-in-1-3b-spac-deal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">going public</a> via SPAC after growing sales 23% last year to a record $567 million. Topps is trying to capitalize on the wider mania in the collectibles market, as bored quarantiners buy cards, sneakers, and non-fungible tokens in Costco portions for Erewhon prices. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Topps's chairman, the former Disney CEO Michael Eisner, doesn't think the collecting craze will end when commuters stop wearing subway gloves. He <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/06/baseball-card-company-topps-to-go-public-through-spac-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told CNBC</a> that Topps today "is in the exact same financial position that Disney was in 1984 when I went there, to the dollar. If we do a tenth as well as we did at Disney, I will be happy." </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's more than a bet on baseball cards</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Topps has its hands in other pockets, and it's pulling up more gold than lint. It owns Bazooka candy and a gift cards business, and it recently announced it’s expanding into NFTs. Eisner calls adding this digital collectible component to its physical offerings "the icing on the cake."</p>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/key-performance-indicators-april-7" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Rangers baseball stadium" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjQ5L3JhbmdlcnNfYmFzZWJhbGxfc3RhZGl1bS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tom Pennington/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> On Monday, the Texas Rangers said that <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/05/sports/baseball/rangers-blue-jays-capacity-photos.html?action=click&module=In%20Other%20News&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">38,238 people</a> attended their home opener against the Toronto Blue Jays—that's 94.8% of Globe Life Field's capacity. It's also the largest crowd at a US sporting event since the pandemic began, topping the Daytona 500 and the Super Bowl. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"It says Covid on the death certificate, but the underlying condition was Amazon." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That's how one bookseller <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-06/amazon-should-be-broken-up-small-merchant-coalition-says?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">described</a> the many challenges facing small businesses today. Now, they're fighting back: Yesterday, small biz organizations introduced Small Business Rising, a coalition that's calling on lawmakers to break up Amazon's retail business from its marketplace business.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Yesterday, the State Department said the US may join allies in boycotting the 2022 Winter Olympics in China. Here’s why the games are controversial and what a boycott might look like. (<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/24/inside-growing-calls-boycott-2022-beijing-winter-olympics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Morning Brew</a>)</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
Q&A
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/tldr-georgias-voting-law?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reader Q&A: The TL;DR of Georgia's Voting Law
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Georgia peach" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjA2L2dlb3JnaWFfcGVhY2guanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bradley in St. Louis:</strong> What's actually in the Georgia voting law that everyone is arguing about? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Morning Brew: </strong>Many readers had questions about the specifics of this law, so let's dive in. High level, this GOP bill has been criticized by voting rights activists for placing new curbs on voting, while Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp insists it expands access.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are some of the <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/04/03/georgia-voting-law-explained/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">main changes</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Limits on absentee ballots: </strong></span><span>The law shrinks the window for voters to request mail-in ballots, allows officials to send ballots only to voters who request them, and introduces ID requirements in place of signature matching.  </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Power to the state government:</strong></span><span> Power over local elections is being stripped from the secretary of state, an elected position, and transferred to a newly created position that's </span><span><em>appointed</em></span><span>. Critics say this removes the nonpartisan flavor of election governance.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">No food in line:</strong></span><span> The law bans handing out food or drink within 150 feet of a polling place or within 25 feet of any voter.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">More access in some cases:</strong></span><span> The GA law guarantees a minimum # of drop boxes for mail ballots per county, expands early voting in most small counties, and adds more resources to polling places where lines get long.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The context is crucial. The US has a long history of suppressing voting access for Black and minority populations, and critics say this law continues that practice. It was also drafted after some GOP lawmakers lobbed baseless allegations of voter fraud during the 2020 election.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Republican supporters of the law say Democrats are spinning false narratives to score political points.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Have another question? </em><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ask us here</em></a><em>. </em></p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/honeywell-william-release-xupermask?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

</font></a>
</h1>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/honeywell-william-release-xupermask" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Honeywell will.i.am xupermask" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjUxL2hvbmV5d2VsbF93aWxsX2lfYW1feHVwZXJtYXNrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Honeywell.com</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Behold—Honeywell x Will.i.am’s “Xupermask,” a collab that <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/06/style/william-face-mask.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">came about</a> after Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff saw the former Black Eyed Peas member wearing a similar mask at last year’s MTV Video Music Awards. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This new-and-improved version <a href="https://www.axios.com/smart-mask-will-i-am-6f45c2a5-04f2-4309-b7a9-7559811013dc.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launches tomorrow</a>, and it’s much more than a rave accessory. Here are some specs: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>HEPA-certified filtration vents</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Noise-cancelling headphones</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dual-speed fans</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>LED lights</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bluetooth-enabled</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The release comes during a <a href="https://time.com/5952051/masks-after-pandemic-ends/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">broader discussion</a> of how often we’ll wear masks once the pandemic winds down. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But more importantly...would you rock this $299 Daft Punk x <em>Blade Runner </em>look? We <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1379469994170388488?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked on Twitter</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.theblockcrypto.com/post/100680/coinbase-q1-results-april-direct-listing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Coinbase</a></span><span> released more financial data ahead of its direct listing next week. It estimates it did $1.8 billion in revenue last quarter. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/06/gm-shares-hit-new-record-on-plans-for-electric-chevy-silverado-pickup.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GM</a></span><span> confirmed rumors that it’s making an electric Chevrolet Silverado pickup, sending shares to a new intraday record yesterday.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/kerryadolan/2021/04/06/forbes-35th-annual-worlds-billionaires-list-facts-and-figures-2021/?sh=333928ce5e58&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Forbes’s</a></span><span> annual billionaires list dropped, and it’s bigger than ever: A record 2,755 people are on the list, and their cumulative wealth has grown $5 trillion since the start of the pandemic to $13+ trillion.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/04/05/983855753/group-chat-app-discord-says-it-banned-more-than-2-000-extremist-communities?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Discord</a></span><span> removed over 2,200 extremist groups from its group-chat app in the latter half of 2020.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

Images/LightRocket via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis may sound bizarre following an economic lockdown that caused more than 20 million jobs to evaporate, but many US companies can't find enough employees to fill their open positions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFirst, the headline stat: \u003c/strong\u003eUS job openings \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-job-openings-jump-to-two-year-high-in-boost-to-labor-market-idUSKBN2BT1TY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged\u003c/a\u003e to a two-year high in February, the Labor Department said yesterday. That number blew past economists' expectations and, when paired with last Friday's \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/us-hiring-surges-march-bigger-rebound-sight?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eA+ jobs report\u003c/a\u003e, shows that employers are ready to hand out offer letters like Lyft discount codes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf only there were workers to accept them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhich sectors are having recruitment trouble?  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRestaurants: \u003c/strong\u003eOn April 21, Taco Bell is holding interviews in thousands of parking lots, and candidates don't even have to get out of their cars to apply. The goal is to hire at least \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-fast-food-labor/fast-food-struggles-to-hire-as-demand-soars-u-s-economy-roars-idUSKBN2BT1GB?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e5,000 people in a single day\u003c/a\u003e to keep up with demand for Quesalupas. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther restaurant execs are facing similar issues. The staffing situation is a \"total nightmare,\" the CEO of Johnny Rockets owner FAT Brands told Reuters.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAirlines:\u003c/strong\u003e Last week, United told staff it plans to hire hundreds of pilots to meet the growing itch to travel. Delta was forced to cancel almost 100 flights over Easter weekend due to a pilot shortage. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eManufacturing: \u003c/strong\u003eFactory activity in the US hit its highest level in 37 years in March, but it \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy-jobs-manufacturing/u-s-factories-desperate-for-workers-even-as-ranks-of-jobless-remains-high-idUKKBN2BP0ZI?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewould've been higher\u003c/a\u003e had there been enough qualified workers to helm production lines. If anyone reading this is a trained welder, there’s a good-paying job for you. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's going on? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe speed and force of the economic recovery have surprised some employers that dramatically lowered their payrolls last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBusiness owners also point to the extra unemployment benefits from the $1.9 trillion stimulus package for keeping would-be workers at home, although research from earlier in the pandemic concluded that the extra weekly benefits did \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/03/is-600-unemployment-boost-a-disincentive-to-work-no-economists-say.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot disincentivize work\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen the job market tightens → salaries get a bump and HR departments start throwing around referral bonuses. Applebee’s is paying $3,000 for manager referrals after the first six months.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf showrunners for HBO's \u003cem\u003eIndustry\u003c/em\u003e are looking for Season 2 inspiration...may we present Credit \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/06/investing/credit-suisse-archegos-losses/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday it's pulling executive board bonuses, suspending buybacks, cutting its dividend, and letting its top investment sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA pattern or apophenia?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSwitzerland's second-largest bank surely wants to sweep this under the \"unprecedented\" banner of the last year. But Archegos is its fourth high-profile slip-up in the last 18 months.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlso in March, Credit Suisse froze $10 billion in funds tied to collapsed financial firm Greensill Capital. It could face ~$1.5 billion in losses.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn April 2020, an accounting scandal imploded Luckin Coffee, whose IPO was underwritten by...Credit Suisse. The bank was on the hook for $100 million worth of defaulted loans.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBaseball card collectors: You can finally tell your parents those boxes in their basement are worth something.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCollectibles-and-more company Topps said it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/michael-eisner-taking-trading-card-company-topps-public-in-1-3b-spac-deal?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egoing public\u003c/a\u003e via SPAC after growing sales 23% last year to a record $567 million. Topps is trying to capitalize on the wider mania in the collectibles market, as bored quarantiners buy cards, sneakers, and non-fungible tokens in Costco portions for Erewhon prices. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Topps's chairman, the former Disney CEO Michael Eisner, doesn't think the collecting craze will end when commuters stop wearing subway gloves. He \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/06/baseball-card-company-topps-to-go-public-through-spac-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold CNBC\u003c/a\u003e that Topps today \"is in the exact same financial position that Disney was in 1984 when I went there, to the dollar. If we do a tenth as well as we did at Disney, I will be happy.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt's more than a bet on baseball cards\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTopps has its hands in other pockets, and it's pulling up more gold than lint. It owns Bazooka candy and a gift cards business, and it recently announced it’s expanding into NFTs. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nReader Q\u0026A: The TL;DR of Georgia's Voting Law\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Georgia peach\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBradley in St. Louis:\u003c/strong\u003e What's actually in the Georgia voting law that everyone is arguing about? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMorning Brew: \u003c/strong\u003eMany readers had questions about the specifics of this law, so let's dive in. High level, this GOP bill has been criticized by voting rights activists for placing new curbs on voting, while Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp insists it expands access.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere are some of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/04/03/georgia-voting-law-explained/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emain changes\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLimits on absentee ballots: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe law shrinks the window for voters to request mail-in ballots, allows officials to send ballots only to voters who request them, and introduces ID requirements in place of signature matching.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePower to the state government:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Power over local elections is being stripped from the secretary of state, an elected position, and transferred to a newly created position that's \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eappointed\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Critics say this removes the nonpartisan flavor of election governance.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo food in line:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The law bans handing out food or drink within 150 feet of a polling place or within 25 feet of any voter.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore access in some cases:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The GA law guarantees a minimum # of drop boxes for mail ballots per county, expands early voting in most small counties, and adds more resources to polling places where lines get long.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe context is crucial. The US has a long history of suppressing voting access for Black and minority populations, and critics say this law continues that practice. It was also drafted after some GOP lawmakers lobbed baseless allegations of voter fraud during the 2020 election.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRepublican supporters of the law say Democrats are spinning false narratives to score political points.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHave another question? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid
